page.title: 16Burton Latimer - Buildings
page.content: The notable buildings are: Parish Church of St. Mary The Virgin Baptist Church, Methodist Church Roman Catholic Church,Burton Latimer Hall,the Manor House,Jacobean House, Meadowside Junior,Infant schools, East Lea St.Mary's Voluntary Controlled School. CHURCH ST. It is the oldest part of the town. Most of the houses are built of ironstone & limestone quarried locally.The roofs are thatched or slated, some with Collyweston Slate.Most houses in the street were built in the 17th & 18th century although some are Victorian.The windows of some houses are leaded. All houses have chimneys.Some have porches. They mostly have large gardens.Jacobean House was once a school.It was established in 1622 as an endowed school.
